intro: Navarretia modocensis, commonly known as Modoc lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It produces small, white or pale blue blossoms that bloom in late spring. Navarretia modocensis is known for its short stature and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
